title: How to Make a Tornado Survival Kit

steps.headline: Find a medium-sized container (preferably plastic to seal out moisture/bugs) that is able to hold at least two small blankets.
Purchase or find the following items:
steps.description:
A whistle A permanent marker A small radio, preferably a self-powered radio A flashlight, preferably a self-powered flashlight A medium sized pack of batteries Canned food or power bars A hand-powered can opener A few small plastic dishes and silverware Two small blankets A phone A few water bottles A first aid kit (Band-Aids, cloth, ect.) Money (preferably small bills)
A car charger for your cell phone
Medicines
A spare set of keys to your vehicle and home
An extra change of clothes for each person
Anything you may need for pets
Anything you may need for children
A multipurpose/knife.

steps.headline: Put all of the objects into the medium-sized container.
Put the container in the shelter/closet/safe room where you will be if there is a tornado warning.
Store bicycle helmets and sneakers in the shelter for each person.
Store your documents safely in the (interior) shelter,  along with a recent copy of one of your utility bills.
steps.description: If your neighborhood is wiped out, you'll need to prove to authorities that you live there.

text:
Find a medium-sized container (preferably plastic to seal out moisture/bugs) that is able to hold at least two small blankets.  Purchase or find the following items: A whistle A permanent marker A small radio, preferably a self-powered radio A flashlight, preferably a self-powered flashlight A medium sized pack of batteries Canned food or power bars A hand-powered can opener A few small plastic dishes and silverware Two small blankets A phone A few water bottles A first aid kit (Band-Aids, cloth, ect.) Money (preferably small bills)
A car charger for your cell phone
Medicines
A spare set of keys to your vehicle and home
An extra change of clothes for each person
Anything you may need for pets
Anything you may need for children
A multipurpose/knife. Put all of the objects into the medium-sized container.  Put the container in the shelter/closet/safe room where you will be if there is a tornado warning.  Store bicycle helmets and sneakers in the shelter for each person.  Store your documents safely in the (interior) shelter,  along with a recent copy of one of your utility bills. If your neighborhood is wiped out, you'll need to prove to authorities that you live there.
sentences: Find a medium-sized container (preferably plastic to seal out moisture/bugs) that is able to hold at least two small blankets.

Purchase or find the following items: A whistle A permanent marker A small radio, preferably a self-powered radio A flashlight, preferably a self-powered flashlight A medium sized pack of batteries Canned food or power bars A hand-powered can opener A few small plastic dishes and silverware Two small blankets A phone A few water bottles A first aid kit (Band-Aids, cloth, ect.)

Money (preferably small bills)
A car charger for your cell phone
Medicines
A spare set of keys to your vehicle and home
An extra change of clothes for each person
Anything you may need for pets
Anything you may need for children
A multipurpose/knife.
Put all of the objects into the medium-sized container.
Put the container in the shelter/closet/safe room where you will be if there is a tornado warning.
Store bicycle helmets and sneakers in the shelter for each person.
Store your documents safely in the (interior) shelter,  along with a recent copy of one of your utility bills.
If your neighborhood is wiped out, you'll need to prove to authorities that you live there.
tyn_section: A few small plastic dishes and silverware
Enough water to last two weeks
Things to do for the kids
